comment: She is a very great teacher. You just need to take plenty of notes and be able to write essays. All of you test are easy you write in class, she will give you the topics before the test. Class is not mandatory she makes you sign in to use as a reference to your grade if you have concerns. She is very chill and helpful.

Ok the ppl who rated her bad probably never showed up to class like at all lol bc tbh you just have to go to the days where participation matters and read the textbook a little bit. Like the exams are essay but if you do go to class they are easy I think I got an 98 in the class it was so easy. And she is so nice and funny, she also brought candy
An amazing professor that I highly would take! She is very helpful and one of the nicest professors ever

This class was pretty easy. As long as you show up to class every time every semester, you should have an A in this class. She gave us a map exam, which the more places you knew, the higher your grade for that exam. You have two exams where you have to explain the stuff you learned. Then, there is going to the sources and the unessay. Take it!

She was definitely my favorite professor Ive had at the whole university. Her course was easy. And i mean very easy. I did the absolute bare minimum and I have a 99% in the course. I almost never read the textbook except to review right before an exam. A lot of the time shell give you 100s on assignments or bonus points just for showing up.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I took Professor Bennett for US History. She is an amazing professor! Although she does a lot of lectures, she makes them engaging and makes it easy to understand the content. Although attendance isn't mandatory, it is important to show up for notes. She does use a textbook, but it is a free online resource! The tests are written but are difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: She is one of my favorite professors I have taken so far. She is perfectly awesome and I will continue to reccomend her and her class. Content is interesting to me which may be why I like it so much. She makes it fun and interesting and is incredibly helpful.
Make sure to read assigned textbook chapters or you wont pass
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: just do not recommend. She does not care about her students much. And her tests are just essays. The good thing is she gives the question beforehand but she grades tough. She does not cut you some slack

She takes attendance but doesn't hold it against you so not mandatory. Its best to take notes and show up because she gives a lot of information and doesn't post. Textbook reading makes it easier. Essay format tests but not hard if you can memorize information. Grades don't take too long to be posted.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Textbook was online. She hardly ever had PowerPoints. Her lectures are good, only if youre actually interested in History. The essay exams were pretty easy, she gives out a rubric for it beforehand so as long as you know what to write, youll get a good grade. I only came to class when there was in class assignments.

I hardly payed attention in class because I found the lectures boring (she was passionate, but I don't like history). She gave a rubric for essay exams so I would study/memorize the night before and usually get an A or high B on it. Pay attention to the syllabus and go in person when there's in person assignments (that's the only time I went).

I really enjoyed taking her class and actually liked learning about history. However, sometimes could be really stressful. Her test were in essay format and required lot of memorizing and conceptualization of specific information. You will definitely need to show up and study, but she keeps it interesting and helps if needed. The class was great!

I wouldnt recommend unless you like essays as tests, her teaching style sucks. You will only learn if you take notes on her power points but she doesnt post them. She expects you to site every piece of information by memory on your exams. Shes nice but shes new to kennesaw and isnt an ideal history professor. She gives extra credit though 3/10

I loved her class, however, if you aren't great at taking notes it could be very difficult. She doesn't share her PowerPoints and if you miss a class you miss a lot of info. Her tests are essays, but they aren't very hard if you can remember important names and dates. You can tell she really cares about her classes and what she teaches! She rocked
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Overall great history teacher, her exams consist of writing an essay, sounds bad but its not. Textbook is free but there is a lot reading, if you are not a reader I advise to not miss a day, she does an overview of each chapter. In all attendance is not required but you miss one day you miss a butt load of a chapter, especially if you didn't read.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader
